CARDINAL . At the material time issues relating to protection of the country ’s heritage were regulated by ORG of DATE ( LOC o ochronie dóbr kultury – “ the Protection of the Cultural Heritage Act ” ) . A decision on listing a real property in the register of historic monuments was taken , in principle , by ORG of ORG ( section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) ) . Following such a decision no work could be carried out on the historic monument unless a permit was granted by the regional inspector ( section CARDINAL ) . LAW imposed various obligations on the owners of listed monuments ; in particular a duty to protect them against any damage .
Section CARDINAL provides , in so far as relevant :

“ ... ownership of a monument of particular historic , scientific or artistic value may be acquired by the ORG with a view to making it accessible to the general public where the public interest so requires . ”
Section CARDINAL provided that the acquisition of ownership took place at the request of the district Mayor or the regional inspector , in accordance with LAW .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG was repealed and ORG of DATE ( LOC o ochronie zabytków i opiece nad zabytkami ) came into force . In contrast to the former LAW , section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of ORG provides that immovable monuments may be expropriated at the request of a regional inspector only where there is a risk of irreversible damage to the monument .
CARDINAL . From DATE to CARDINAL DATE the rules governing the administration of land held by ORG and the municipalities were laid down in ORG DATE ( “ LAW DATE ” ) .
On DATE LAW DATE was repealed and LAW of DATE ( LOC o gospodarce nieruchomościami – “ LAW CARDINAL ” ) came into force .
Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of the LAW , which was introduced by ORG , stipulates that the protection of real properties classified as monuments within the meaning of ORG is a public - interest aim .

Under section CARDINAL of that Act , expropriation consists in taking away , by virtue of an administrative decision , ownership or other rights in rem . Expropriation can be carried out where public - interest aims can not be achieved without restriction of those rights and where it is impossible to acquire those rights by way of a civil - law contract . Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) stipulates that expropriation can only be carried out for the benefit of ORG or the local municipality .

Section CARDINAL ) of the LAW provides that the institution of expropriation proceedings is to be preceded by negotiations on acquisition of the property under a civil - law contract between the ORG , represented by the district Mayor , and the owner . In the framework of those negotiations the ORG may propose an alternative property to the owner .

ORG ) of the LAW stipulates that expropriation proceedings for the benefit of ORG are to be instituted of the latter ’s own motion . The expropriation proceedings for the benefit of the local municipality are instituted at the request of the latter . Only where the request is submitted by the local municipality does refusal take the form of an administrative decision ( decyzja ; section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) ) .
